clinical_study.brief_title: Incidence of Deep Vein Thrombosis at Doppler Echo in Covid-19 Patients With SARS-Cov-2 Pneumopathy Hospitalized in ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence of Deep Vein Thrombosis at Doppler Echo in Patients With SARS-Cov-2 Pneumopathy Hospitalized in ICU

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective of the study is to determine the incidence of deep vein thromboses at Doppler echo in patients with SARS-Cov-2 pneumopathy upon their entry into ICU and after 7 days of hospitalization in ICU.
This is a monocentric interventional study (RIPH 2).

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Deep Vein Thrombosis at Doppler Echo in Patients With SARS-Cov-2 Pneumopathy Hospitalized in ICU
primary_outcome.description: Deep vein thrombosis at Doppler echo

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Deep Vein Thrombosis at Doppler Echo in Patients With SARS-Cov-2 Pneumopathy Hospitalized in ICU
primary_outcome.description: Deep vein thrombosis at Doppler echo

arm_group.description: patients will have a Doppler Echo when they enter ICU (within 48 hours) and a second Doppler Echo 7 days later

intervention.description: 2 doppler echo will be done at patients hospitalized in ICU and with SARS-CoV-2 pneumopathy at 7 days apart

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient > or =18 years
- Hospitalization in intensive care
- PCR COVID 19+ or compatible clinical signs (fever, cough, myalgia, asthenia, loss of taste, anosmia) associated with compatible radiological signs
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy in progress
- Patient <18 years
- Patients deprived of freedoms or under guardianship
- Patient or family opponent of protocol participation
- patient on curative anticoagulant for more than 48H00
- impossible Venous Doppler Echo
